and broken communities. Michael Vick now talks to kids-kids growing up like he did-about the mistakes he made. Carolyn Kilborn of Maryland Votes for Animals thinks Michael Vick 's work is valuable, telling the Baltimore Sun: Kids... are more likely to listen to someone like Michael Vick . He can do a lot of good for troubled kids... He has the power to make a change in kids' hearts like few other people can.
